sources: https://mexicobusiness.news/health/news/boehringer-ingelheim-invests-us188-million-xochimilco-plant

description: Villanueva Solar Park: 828 MW capacity, one of largest solar installations in Americas. Covers 2,400 hectares. $710M investment. Generates enough electricity for 1.3 million homes annually.
sources: Enel Green Power. Various years. Corporate press release; BloombergNEF (BNEF). Various years. Energy project database. New York: Bloomberg; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; Secretaría de Energía (SENER). Mexico City

description: 396MW wind farm in Oaxaca's Isthmus of Tehuantepec wind corridor. $1.2B investment by consortium including Mitsubishi. One of Mexico's largest wind farms. Isthmus hosts 2.5GW+ of installed wind capacity.
sources: Asociación Mexicana de Energía Eólica (AMDEE). Mexico City; Mitsubishi. Various years. Corporate press release; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; Secretaría de Energía (SENER). Mexico City

company_name: Pemex / Federal Government - Dos Bocas Refinery
description: Olmeca Refinery (Dos Bocas): 340,000 barrels/day crude processing capacity. $16.8B federal investment (originally budgeted $8B). Operational since mid-2024. Aim: reduce gasoline imports. Mexico's first new refinery in 40+ years. Significant cost overruns and delays.
sources: Petróleos Mexicanos (Pemex). Mexico City; Secretaría de Energía (SENER). Mexico City; Gobierno del Estado de Tabasco; Financial Times (London). Various years. News reporting; Reuters (London). Various years. News reporting; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Cumulative wind farm investments across Oaxaca's Isthmus corridor (2.5GW+ installed). Operators include Acciona, EDF, Iberdrola, Enel, and others. World-class wind resource with average speeds 10+ m/s. Subject to ongoing indigenous community consultation requirements.
sources: Asociación Mexicana de Energía Eólica (AMDEE). Mexico City; Secretaría de Energía (SENER). Mexico City; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; International Energy Agency (IEA). 2024. Mexico Energy Policy Review. Paris: IEA

description: Proposed lithium mining operation at Sonora Lithium Project (world's largest lithium deposit at 8.8M tonnes). Ganfeng (China) acquired Bacanora. Status uncertain after 2022 mining law nationalization of lithium and ongoing community/environmental disputes.
sources: Reuters (London). Various years. News reporting; Bloomberg (New York). Various years. News reporting; Gobierno del Estado de Sonora; Congreso de la Unión. 2022. Reforma a la Ley de Minería. Diario Oficial de la Federación. Mexico City; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Major expansion of railroad freight car production facility in two phases, including 7,500 sq m welding/painting facility and 13,000 sq m special railroad car facility.
sources: La Jornada de Oriente (Puebla). 2023. News reporting; somosindustria.com. Various years. Industry reporting

description: Expansion of Medtronic's Tijuana operations (6 plants). Major investment in surgical robotics and cardiac device manufacturing. Part of $1.5B+ cumulative Medtronic Mexico investment.
sources: Medtronic. Various years. Corporate press release; Forbes México (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting; Consejo de Desarrollo Económico de Tijuana (CDT)

description: Expansion of Nissan A2 plant for new vehicle platform production. Part of broader $2B+ Nissan Mexico investment cycle including powertrain and stamping upgrades.
sources: Nissan. 2023. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Aguascalientes; El Economista (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

company_name: CFE / IDB Cerro Prieto Geothermal Modernization
description: IDB-financed modernization of Cerro Prieto geothermal complex (570MW installed capacity), one of world's largest. Upgrading turbines, steam management, and injection systems. Part of $108M IDB geothermal package.
sources: IDB Invest (Inter-American Development Bank Group). Washington, DC; CFE; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE)

description: Expansion of Foxconn's electronic manufacturing services complex in Juárez. Produces servers, networking equipment, and consumer electronics for US market. Part of nearshoring wave from Asia.
sources: Foxconn; Asociación de Maquiladoras (INDEX), Delegación Juárez; Reuters (London). 2023. News reporting

description: Planned server and data center equipment manufacturing facility. $320M announced investment. Project paused pending clarification of US-China tech export controls and USMCA compliance for Chinese-owned Taiwanese companies.
sources: Reuters (London). 2023. News reporting; Bloomberg (New York). Various years. News reporting; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Multi-year expansion of Saltillo assembly complex including new RAM truck production lines and engine plant modernization. Stellantis operates 5 plants across Coahuila/Mexico. $1.6B in recent committed investments.
sources: Stellantis. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Coahuila; Automotive News (Detroit). Various years. News reporting

description: Wind turbine nacelle assembly plant serving Mexican and export markets. $200M cumulative investment. Produces 2-3MW onshore turbine nacelles. Part of Mexico's wind energy supply chain.
sources: Siemens Gamesa. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Tamaulipas; Asociación Mexicana de Energía Eólica (AMDEE). Mexico City

description: Enel's Mexico renewable energy portfolio: 3GW+ solar and wind capacity. Includes Villanueva (828MW solar, Coahuila), Dolores (244MW wind, Tamaulipas), and others. $1.5B cumulative Mexico renewable investment.
sources: Enel Green Power. Various years. Corporate press release; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; BloombergNEF (BNEF). Various years. Energy project database. New York: Bloomberg; Asociación Mexicana de Energía Eólica (AMDEE). Mexico City

description: Major expansion of Honeywell's aerospace manufacturing complex in Juárez. Produces engines, avionics, and auxiliary power units. Chihuahua hosts 46+ aerospace companies. $432M cumulative investment.
sources: Honeywell. Various years. Corporate press release; Asociación de Maquiladoras (INDEX), Delegación Juárez; Gobierno del Estado de Chihuahua. Various years. Official announcements and economic development data

company_name: ACCIONA Energía - San Carlos Wind Farm
description: San Carlos wind farm complex: 321MW capacity across multiple phases. $500M investment by ACCIONA. One of largest wind installations in northeast Mexico. High wind speeds from Gulf of Mexico.
sources: ACCIONA Energía. Various years. Corporate press release; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; Asociación Mexicana de Energía Eólica (AMDEE). Mexico City; Gobierno del Estado de Tamaulipas

description: Retooling and expansion of Ford Hermosillo assembly plant for new Bronco Sport and Maverick production. $700M in recent investments. Plant has operated since 1986.
sources: Ford Motor. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Sonora; Automotive News (Detroit). Various years. News reporting; Comisión de Fomento al Turismo del Estado de Sonora (CODESON). Hermosillo

description: Modernization and expansion of Los Azufres geothermal field (227MW installed). Upgrades to Units 17-18 and new binary cycle units. One of three major Mexican geothermal complexes alongside Cerro Prieto (BC) and Los Humeros (Puebla).
sources: CFE; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; IDB Invest (Inter-American Development Bank Group). Washington, DC. geothermal program

description: Service and assembly center for Airbus helicopters serving Latin American market. $50M investment in MRO (maintenance, repair, overhaul) capabilities and assembly operations.
sources: Airbus. Various years. Corporate press release; Aeroclúster de Querétaro, A.C. Querétaro; Gobierno del Estado de Querétaro

description: Expansion of Toyota manufacturing complex including new Apaseo el Grande plant ($900M) and Salamanca plant upgrades ($550M). Produces Tacoma pickup trucks for North American market.
sources: Toyota Motor. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Guanajuato; Coordinadora de Fomento al Comercio Exterior del Estado de Guanajuato (COFOCE). León; Automotive News (Detroit). Various years. News reporting

description: Mega steel complex featuring hot-rolling mill with 4M metric ton annual capacity. $3.2B phased investment making it one of largest industrial investments in Latin America. Supplies automotive, appliance, and construction sectors.
sources: Ternium. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; Consejo Nuevo León para la Planeación Estratégica. Monterrey; El Financiero (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Announced March 2023: Tesla's first Mexico Gigafactory for EV and battery production. Originally $15B including battery cell manufacturing. Paused/scaled back April 2024 amid US political pressure and tariff uncertainty. Site acquired, permits in progress but construction delayed.
sources: Tesla. Various years. Corporate press release; Reuters (London). Various years. News reporting; Bloomberg (New York). Various years. News reporting; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; Wall Street Journal (New York). 2024. News reporting

description: Expansion of Altamira petrochemical cluster by multiple operators (Braskem Idesa, Indorama, Mexichem). $300M in combined new capacity for PVC, PET, and polyethylene production.
sources: Gobierno del Estado de Tamaulipas; Braskem Idesa; El Economista (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Hotel and tourism infrastructure investments linked to Tren Maya station connectivity. Multiple resort developments in Tulum, Bacalar, and Cancún corridor. $500M+ in announced private investment post-Tren Maya inauguration.
sources: Fondo Nacional de Fomento al Turismo (FONATUR). Mexico City; Secretaría de Turismo (SECTUR). Mexico City; Gobierno del Estado de Quintana Roo; El Economista (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Expansion of Bombardier business jet manufacturing and flight test center. Querétaro facility produces structural fuselage components and performs final assembly work. $18M recent expansion.
sources: Bombardier. Various years. Corporate press release; Aeroclúster de Querétaro, A.C. Querétaro; Gobierno del Estado de Querétaro

description: Expansion of Continental's SLP operations producing braking systems, electronics, and interior components. Part of Continental's $1B+ Mexico portfolio across 25+ plants.
sources: Continental AG. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de San Luis Potosí; El Economista (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Green hydrogen production facility using solar-powered electrolysis. $1.17B investment for hydrogen production for export and domestic use. Would leverage Sinaloa's high solar irradiance.
sources: DH2 Energy. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Sinaloa; Energía Hoy (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting; Forbes México (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Green methanol production plant using captured CO2 and green hydrogen. $350M announced investment. Green methanol used as marine fuel (IMO decarbonization), chemical feedstock, and fuel-cell input.
sources: Mexinol. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Sinaloa; Energía Hoy (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: New medical device manufacturing facility in Tijuana medical devices cluster. Baja California hosts 70+ medical device companies employing 65,000+ workers, making it Mexico's largest medtech cluster.
sources: Boston Scientific press release. 2024; ProMéxico, Agencia del Gobierno Federal. Mexico City; Clúster de Dispositivos Médicos de Baja California. Tijuana

description: Plan Sonora semiconductor cluster development including chip testing, packaging, and assembly facilities. Part of Plan Mexico's Centro Kutsari initiative for Mexican semiconductor capacity. Multiple companies exploring investments.
sources: Gobierno del Estado de Sonora; Gobierno del Estado de Sonora. Plan Sonora de Energías Limpias. Hermosillo; Comisión de Fomento al Turismo del Estado de Sonora (CODESON). Hermosillo; Presidencia de la República. 2025. Plan México. Mexico City; El Economista (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Major expansion of BMW San Luis Potosí plant for next-generation Neue Klasse electric vehicle platform. $870M investment for production of BMW iX3 successor. Plant also produces 3 Series sedan. Will become BMW's first full-EV plant in Americas.
sources: BMW AG. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de San Luis Potosí; Bloomberg (New York). Various years. News reporting; Automotive News (Detroit). 2024. News reporting

description: Non-carbonated beverage plant installation with multi-phase investment. Generates 100 direct jobs and 250 indirect jobs.
sources: mexicoindustry.com. 2024. Industry reporting

description: Expansion of continuously variable transmission (CVT) plant. Jatco is Nissan subsidiary; plant supplies transmissions for Nissan, Mitsubishi, and Suzuki vehicles assembled in Mexico.
sources: Jatco México; Consejo para el Desarrollo Económico de Aguascalientes

description: Expansion of powersports vehicle manufacturing (ATVs, side-by-sides, Sea-Doo). $185M in recent facility investments across Juárez complex.
sources: BRP. Various years. Corporate press release; Asociación de Maquiladoras (INDEX), Delegación Juárez. 2024. Official data and announcements

description: Mega solar park: 1GW capacity on 4,000 hectares in Sonora desert. Phase 1 (120MW, Jinko Solar panels) inaugurated 2024. Full buildout $1.7B+. Flagship Plan Sonora project. Will be one of largest solar installations in Latin America when complete.
sources: CFE; Gobierno del Estado de Sonora; Gobierno del Estado de Sonora. Plan Sonora de Energías Limpias. Hermosillo; Secretaría de Energía (SENER). Mexico City; BloombergNEF (BNEF). Various years. Energy project database. New York: Bloomberg. 2024. Official data and announcements

description: Continued expansion of Safran's aerospace cluster in Querétaro. $115M+ cumulative recent investment. Produces aircraft engine components, landing gear, and nacelles. Querétaro hosts 80+ aerospace companies (Mexico's #1 aerospace cluster).
sources: Safran. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Querétaro; Aeroclúster de Querétaro, A.C. Querétaro; Forbes México (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Joint oil and gas development project approved by CNH. Campeche portion for offshore drilling and installation construction.
sources: El Financiero (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: New fulfillment center and last-mile logistics hub in Apodaca, part of Amazon's Mexico expansion. $200M investment in automated warehouse and distribution infrastructure.
sources: Amazon México; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; El Financiero (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Expansion of BD's Ciudad Juárez medical device campus. Produces syringes, catheters, and diagnostic equipment. $150M recent expansion across 3 plants. Part of Juárez medical devices cluster.
sources: BD. Various years. Corporate press release; Asociación de Maquiladoras (INDEX), Delegación Juárez; Gobierno del Estado de Chihuahua; Forbes México (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Regional e-commerce fulfillment center for Yucatán Peninsula. $94M investment by Latin America's largest e-commerce company. 50,000+ sqm automated warehouse serving QRoo, Campeche, Yucatán, and Tabasco.
sources: Mercado Libre. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Yucatán; El Financiero (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Proposed EV battery components facility in SLP industrial corridor. Samsung SDI exploring Mexico operations to supply BMW, Stellantis, and other OEMs. Part of Korean battery supply chain nearshoring.
sources: Samsung SDI; Gobierno del Estado de San Luis Potosí; Reuters (London). Various years. News reporting; El Economista (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

green_reason: Diversified renewable energy portfolio including wind, solar, combined-cycle gas with high-efficiency cogeneration
description: Iberdrola's $6B Mexico reinvestment program across wind farms, solar parks, and combined-cycle gas plants. 9GW+ installed capacity. Largest private electricity generator in Mexico. Operations in Puebla, Guanajuato, Oaxaca, Tamaulipas, Altamira, and others.
sources: Iberdrola. Various years. Corporate press release; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; Bolsa Mexicana de Valores (BMV). Corporate filings. Mexico City; Forbes México (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: New Heineken brewery in Hunucmá, west of Mérida. $510M investment for production of Tecate, Sol, Dos Equis, and Heineken brands. Capacity: 5M hectoliters/year. Yucatán's largest single industrial investment.
sources: Heineken. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Yucatán; Forbes México (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting; El Financiero (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: National electricity transmission grid modernization: $8.2B investment in high-voltage transmission lines, substations, and smart grid technology across 24 states. Part of Plan Mexico energy sovereignty strategy. Includes renewable energy integration infrastructure.
sources: CFE; Secretaría de Energía (SENER). Mexico City; Presidencia de la República. 2025. Plan México. Mexico City; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). Mexico City; El Economista (Mexico City). 2025. News reporting

description: ENGIE's Mexico renewable portfolio: solar parks and gas-fired generation. $800M in recent Mexico investments. Key projects in Sonora (solar), and natural gas infrastructure in northern border states.
sources: ENGIE. Various years. Corporate press release; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; Gobierno del Estado de Sonora; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

green_reason: LNG and natural gas infrastructure displaces diesel/fuel oil; solar projects in portfolio
description: Sempra Infrastructure (IEnova) Mexico energy portfolio: LNG import/export terminal (Ensenada), natural gas pipelines, and solar generation. $1.2B in recent Mexico infrastructure investments.
sources: Sempra/IEnova. Various years. Corporate press release; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; Bolsa Mexicana de Valores (BMV). Corporate filings. Mexico City; Bloomberg (New York). 2024. News reporting

description: VW Puebla e-mobility transformation: $763.5M to retool plant for electric and hybrid vehicle production. Plant has produced 12M+ vehicles since 1964 (Beetle, Jetta, Tiguan). New investment for MEB/SSP electric platform vehicles.
sources: Volkswagen AG. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Puebla; Automotive News (Detroit). Various years. News reporting; Reuters (London). 2024. News reporting

description: Expansion of Mexico's second-largest Pacific port. New container terminal, rail improvements, and intermodal logistics zone. $750M+ investment. Key nearshoring gateway for Asian trade.
sources: Administración del Sistema Portuario Nacional de Lázaro Cárdenas (ASIPONA). Lázaro Cárdenas; Secretaría de Infraestructura, Comunicaciones y Transportes (SICT). Mexico City; Presidencia de la República. 2025. Plan México. Mexico City. infrastructure; El Economista (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Proposed mega-scale green hydrogen production hub in Isthmus of Tehuantepec ($10B). Would use 2.5GW+ renewable energy (wind/solar) to power electrolyzers for green hydrogen and ammonia production. Linked to CIIT infrastructure corridor. Largest proposed green hydrogen project in Latin America.
sources: Helax Energía; CIIT; Gobierno del Estado de Oaxaca; Energía Hoy (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting; Reuters (London). Various years. News reporting

description: Expansion of Bosch manufacturing and R&D center. Produces braking systems, powertrain components, and sensors. Querétaro hosts Bosch's largest Mexico operations. $150M recent investment.
sources: Bosch. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Querétaro; El Economista (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Green ammonia production plant using renewable-powered electrolysis. Would produce ammonia for fertilizer without fossil fuel inputs. Part of emerging green hydrogen economy in Mexico.
sources: Tarafert. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Durango; Energía Hoy (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Proposed EV battery gigafactory by world's largest battery manufacturer. Announced $5B investment for lithium-ion battery cell production to supply North American automakers. Subject to US political scrutiny over Chinese investment in Mexico.
sources: Reuters (London). 2024. News reporting; Bloomberg (New York). Various years. News reporting; Wall Street Journal (New York). Various years. News reporting; CATL. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Chihuahua

description: Expansion of ZF automotive components plant producing transmissions and chassis systems. Part of ZF's $500M+ Mexico portfolio.
sources: ZF Group. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Coahuila; Clúster Automotriz de la Región Sureste de Coahuila (CARSEC). Saltillo

description: Expansion of Whirlpool's Ramos Arizpe appliance manufacturing complex. Produces refrigerators, washing machines, and cooking appliances for Mexican and US markets. $100M recent facility upgrade.
sources: Whirlpool. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Coahuila; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Expansion of Carrier's HVAC manufacturing complex. $150M investment in energy-efficient heating, cooling, and refrigeration systems. Includes heat pump production lines for North American market.
sources: Carrier Global. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; Consejo Nuevo León para la Planeación Estratégica. Monterrey

description: Large-scale luxury hotel and resort development along Riviera Nayarit coast. Multiple projects including One&Only Mandarina ($650M), Conrad Punta de Mita, Four Seasons Navidad, St. Regis, and other 5-star properties. Combined $3B+ pipeline.
sources: Fondo Nacional de Fomento al Turismo (FONATUR). Mexico City; Secretaría de Turismo (SECTUR). Mexico City; Gobierno del Estado de Nayarit; Forbes México (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting; Expansión (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Ethylene XXI complex expansion and new Advario terminal. Braskem Idesa operates Latin America's largest ethylene cracker ($5.2B original). New $500M investment in downstream polyethylene and storage expansion.
sources: Braskem Idesa. Various years. Corporate press release; Advario; Gobierno del Estado de Veracruz; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

company_name: Hyatt Hotels (Park Hyatt Cabo del Sol)
description: First Park Hyatt branded hotel in Mexico, 163 accommodations at Cabo del Sol luxury resort. Part of broader 900M USD luxury hotel investment program in Los Cabos.
sources: Hyatt Newsroom. 2024; Tribuna de México. Various years. News reporting

description: Expansion of Nemak's (Alfa subsidiary) lightweight structural components for EVs. New aluminum battery housings and structural EV parts. $200M investment in new lines.
sources: Nemak. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; Bloomberg (New York). Various years. News reporting; Bolsa Mexicana de Valores (BMV). Corporate filings. Mexico City

description: Expansion of catalytic converter and exhaust system manufacturing. Katcon (HQ Monterrey) is one of world's top-5 catalytic converter makers, supplying GM, Ford, Stellantis, VW.
sources: Katcon. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; Consejo Nuevo León para la Planeación Estratégica. Monterrey

description: Aluminum die-casting plant for automotive components. Supplies engine blocks, transmission cases, and structural parts to Japanese and US automakers. Part of nearshoring-driven Japanese automotive supplier migration.
sources: Ahresty. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Zacatecas; El Economista (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: New pharmaceutical manufacturing complex in Ciudad Sahagún. Carnot is one of Mexico's largest domestic pharma companies. Part of growing pharma cluster in Hidalgo attracting investment from Plan Mexico's pharmaceutical initiative.
sources: Carnot Laboratorios. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Hidalgo; El Economista (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Retooling of Ramos Arizpe complex for electric and hybrid vehicle production including Chevrolet Equinox EV. $2B+ investment in paint shop, battery assembly, and production lines. Largest single EV investment in Mexico.
sources: GM. 2024. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Coahuila; Reuters (London). Various years. News reporting; Automotive News (Detroit). Various years. News reporting

description: Expansion of Hershey chocolate and confectionery plant in El Salto. $90M investment in new production lines and packaging. Plant supplies Mexican and Latin American markets.
sources: Hershey. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Jalisco; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: New steel manufacturing complex expansion by Mexico's leading steel wire and rebar producer. Includes electric arc furnace, rolling mill, and downstream processing. Supplies construction and automotive sectors.
sources: Grupo Deacero. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Coahuila; El Financiero (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Major expansion of Manzanillo, Mexico's busiest Pacific port (3.1M TEU). New container terminal, expanded berths, rail connectivity. Part of Plan Mexico infrastructure to capture Asia-Pacific nearshoring trade.
sources: Administración del Sistema Portuario Nacional de Manzanillo (ASIPONA). Manzanillo; Secretaría de Infraestructura, Comunicaciones y Transportes (SICT). description: Solar panel manufacturing factory: $582M investment for production of photovoltaic modules. Aims to produce panels for domestic and export markets. One of first major solar manufacturing plants in Mexico.
sources: Solarever. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Durango; Forbes México (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Investment in Silao engine and transmission plant for new powertrain production. Plant produces V8 engines and 10-speed transmissions for F-150 and other Ford trucks.
sources: Ford Motor. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Guanajuato; Coordinadora de Fomento al Comercio Exterior del Estado de Guanajuato (COFOCE). León

description: Expansion of KIA Pesquería assembly plant ($558M additional investment). Plant produces Forte sedan and Rio subcompact. 300,000 vehicle annual capacity. Includes supplier park with 17 Korean Tier-1 suppliers.
sources: KIA Motors. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; Consejo Nuevo León para la Planeación Estratégica. Monterrey

description: Retooling of Silao complex for next-generation pickup truck and EV component production. Includes new Ultium battery pack assembly and electric drive unit manufacturing.
sources: GM. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Guanajuato; Reuters (London). Various years. News reporting; Coordinadora de Fomento al Comercio Exterior del Estado de Guanajuato (COFOCE). León

description: Continued investment in Salamanca assembly plant (250,000 vehicle/year capacity). Produces Mazda2 and Mazda3 for Americas. $150M in recent facility modernization.
sources: Mazda. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Guanajuato; Coordinadora de Fomento al Comercio Exterior del Estado de Guanajuato (COFOCE). León

description: Expansion of Pirelli tire manufacturing complex. Annual capacity 6M+ tires. Supplies OEM and aftermarket for North American automotive sector.
sources: Pirelli. Various years. Corporate press release; Coordinadora de Fomento al Comercio Exterior del Estado de Guanajuato (COFOCE). León; Gobierno del Estado de Guanajuato

description: Post-Hurricane Otis reconstruction of Acapulco hotel/tourism zone. $386M+ in combined federal, state, and private investment to rebuild hotels, infrastructure, and tourism facilities destroyed in October 2023.
sources: Gobierno del Estado de Guerrero; Secretaría de Turismo (SECTUR). Mexico City; Forbes México (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting; El Universal (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Expansion of PiSA manufacturing capacity in Hidalgo pharma corridor. PiSA is Mexico's largest pharmaceutical manufacturer. New lines for injectable and oral medications.
sources: PiSA Farmacéutica; Gobierno del Estado de Hidalgo; Milenio (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Major expansion of Intel's Guadalajara Design Center (GDC), one of Intel's largest non-US engineering facilities. 4,000+ engineers working on chip design, validation, and AI/ML. $2B cumulative investment. Anchors Jalisco's tech ecosystem.
sources: Intel. Various years. Corporate press release; iJalisco; Gobierno del Estado de Jalisco; Bloomberg (New York). 2024. News reporting

description: New cloud computing data center in Guadalajara metro area. Part of Oracle's Latin American cloud expansion. $758M investment supports AI and enterprise cloud workloads.
sources: Oracle. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Jalisco; Forbes México (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: New appliance and consumer electronics manufacturing complex. Hisense expanding Mexico operations to serve North American market, leveraging USMCA rules of origin.
sources: Hisense press release; Gobierno del Estado de Baja California; El Economista (Mexico City). 2024. News reporting

description: Expansion of Flex's Guadalajara electronics manufacturing campus. Produces servers, medical devices, and industrial electronics. Jalisco hosts 100+ electronics/IT companies.
sources: Flex. Various years. Corporate press release; iJalisco; Gobierno del Estado de Jalisco

description: Expansion of TCS Mexico delivery center in Guadalajara. 2,000+ employees providing IT services, software development, and nearshore delivery for US clients.
sources: TCS. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Jalisco; El Economista (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: New aluminum beverage can manufacturing plant. $300M investment for 4B+ can annual capacity. Supplies Heineken, Constellation Brands, Arca Continental, and other beverage companies in Mexico.
sources: Ball Corporation. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Nuevo León; Consejo Nuevo León para la Planeación Estratégica. Monterrey; El Financiero (Mexico City). Various years. News reporting

description: Audi San José Chiapa plant transition to electric vehicle production. €1B (~$1B) investment for Q5 e-tron assembly. Plant currently produces Q5 SUV; will convert to Premium Platform Electric (PPE). Single-largest German automotive EV investment in Mexico.
sources: Audi AG. Various years. Corporate press release; Gobierno del Estado de Puebla; Bloomberg (New York). Various years. News reporting; Handelsblatt (Düsseldorf). 2025. News reporting

description: mRNA vaccine technology transfer from Moderna to Laboratorios Liomont. Two phases: fill-finish operations, then full API/mRNA manufacturing. Will produce COVID-19, dengue, and cancer vaccines domestically. Investment ~10,480M MXN.
sources: Presidencia; Moderna. Various years. Corporate press release; Presidencia de la República. 2025. Plan México. Mexico City. pharmaceutical initiative 2026

description: Proposed expansion/modernization of Laguna Verde nuclear plant (1,552MW, Mexico's only nuclear facility). Studies underway for Unit 3 expansion and operational life extension of Units 1-2 beyond 2050. Part of Mexico's clean energy baseload strategy.
sources: CFE; Secretaría de Energía (SENER). Mexico City; International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). Vienna; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; Presidencia de la República. 2025. Plan México. Mexico City. energy; El Economista (Mexico City). 2025. News reporting

description: Mexico's national electric vehicle project (Proyecto Olinia) building on Zacua Motors' EV platform. Government-supported initiative to develop a Mexican-made electric vehicle. Linked to Plan Mexico innovation program and Centro Kutsari semiconductor initiative.
sources: Presidencia; Presidencia de la República. 2025. Plan México. Mexico City; Gobierno del Estado de Puebla; Forbes México (Mexico City). 2025. News reporting

description: December 2025 SENER announcement: 20 new renewable energy projects awarded totaling $4.75B. Primarily solar and wind across multiple states. Part of Mexico's commitment to expand clean energy capacity under Plan Mexico.
sources: Secretaría de Energía (SENER). Mexico City; Comisión Reguladora de Energía (CRE). Mexico City; BloombergNEF (BNEF). Various years. Energy project database. New York: Bloomberg; Reuters (London). 2025. News reporting

description: Volvo Group increased investment in new Monterrey truck manufacturing plant from US$700M to US$1B. Operations set to begin in 2026.
sources: Mexico News Daily. 2025. "Foreign investment is setting records in a tough economy." https://mexiconewsdaily.com/business/foreign-investment-mexico-2025/. Accessed February 2026.

description: Stellantis expanding Saltillo, Coahuila facility to boost production to nearly 1 million engines annually. Plans to launch up to 15 new vehicle models in 2025.
sources: Mexico News Daily. 2025. "Foreign investment is setting records in a tough economy." https://mexiconewsdaily.com/business/foreign-investment-mexico-2025/. Accessed February 2026.

description: Indian tractor manufacturer TAFE inaugurated new assembly plant in Aguascalientes. US$15M investment, expected to generate 250 jobs.
sources: Mexico Business News. 2025. "Mexico Continues to Attract FDI." https://mexicobusiness.news/trade-and-investment/news/mexico-continues-attract-fdi. Accessed February 2026.

description: ELAM-FAW announced construction of new automotive manufacturing plant in Colima with MXN 7 billion investment over 5 years. Operations from Hidalgo plant will relocate. Serves domestic market and exports to Latin America.
sources: MarkLines. 2024. "ELAM-FAW Announces Details of New Plant in Colima, Mexico." MarkLines Automotive Industry Portal, September 25, 2024.
